pr_title: Validate future checks latest & pass attestations to pool

timeline.message: Validate future checks latest & pass attestations to Pool
Close of future Attestation DOS vector

timeline.bodyText: This should be volatile as it could potentially be accessed from multiple threads.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: I'd say this should just take an IndexedAttestation and push responsibility for ensuring IndexedAttestation all the way up to AttestationManager.  It shouldn't ever add an attestation to FutureAttestation that hasn't passed validation.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: In that case, would FutureAttestation only holding IndexedAttestations make sense?
replies.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText: One downside is that maybe we want to pass the attestation back to the networking layer once we take it out from FutureAttestation. Also, keeping a reference to the DelayableAttestation (the higher-level object) is more in line with the ValidateableAttestation concept, so I might just keep items in FutureAttestation as DelayableAttestations.
replies.author: cemozerr

timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText:
This is where I'd check the IndexedAttestation exists and log an error if it doesn't indicating that somehow an unvalidated attestation got into the future pool (then don't process it obviously).
At the moment you could actually make futureAttestations just hold IndexedAttestation but that's only because we aren't currently calling delayableAttestation.onAttestationProcessedSuccessfully for attestations we process from futureAttestations.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: This is exactly what I did after reading your previous comment and having not seen this :D
replies.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText:
But now we're never even able to call onAttestationProcessedSuccessfully when the delayed attestation is actually processed.   I guess the event it fires doesn't actually do anything for now, but we'll probably have to change this back when we want to start gossiping attestations after we process them (if we haven't already).
Although, whether we gossiped something or not seems like a nice thing to track in ValidatableAttestation so maybe it will work out...
replies.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: Looking at how all the code has worked out this bit now makes more sense - we're not firing the unused events any more - the on processed event just adds it to the aggregate pool which we've already done for saved attestations.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: 10 is probably too generous actually.  Really the only reason for this to happen is clock drift or if Teku is lagging behind slightly so 99% of the time it will only be one slot ahead so I'd probably limit it to something like 3 - that gives a 36 second buffer which should be plenty.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: Yeah that makes sense. Can't believe I gave a 120 second buffer 😂
replies.author: cemozerr

timeline.bodyText: Is it just me or should isAfterPropagationSlotRange really be isBeforePropagationSlotRange?  ie it's valid if it's after the propagation slot range and invalid if it's from too far back.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: Yes it should be isBefore, I'll do the switch.
replies.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText:
No, on second thought, isAfterPropagationSlotRange is correct. Because it does not refer to the attestation, it refers to the current time. Current time is after the attestations propagation slot range, thus the naming. I'll change these methods to:

isCurrentTimeAfterAttestationPropagationSlotRange
isCurrentTimeBeforeMinimumAttestationBroadcastTime
replies.author: cemozerr

timeline.bodyText: nit: Suggest extracting the currentTimeMillis.plus bit to a variable - something like discardAttestationsAfterMillis.  Just makes the comparison clearer.
timeline.author: ajsutton
